TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed TabletHardwareCapabilities extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines values that specify the hardware capabilities of a tablet device, including desktop digitizers and mice.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration has a <xref:System.FlagsAttribute> attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to determine the hardware capabilities of a tablet device.
[!code-vb[HwCaps#26](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/HwCaps_VB/Window1.xaml.vb#26)] [!code-cs[HwCaps#26](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/HwCaps_CS/Window1.xaml.cs#26)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.TabletHardwareCapabilities HardProximity = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Indicates the tablet device can generate in-air packets when the stylus is in the physical detection range (proximity) of the tablet device.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.TabletHardwareCapabilities Integrated = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates the digitizer is integrated with the display.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.TabletHardwareCapabilities None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates the tablet device cannot provide this information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.TabletHardwareCapabilities StylusHasPhysicalIds = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Indicates the tablet device can uniquely identify the active stylus.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.TabletHardwareCapabilities StylusMustTouch = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates the stylus must be in physical contact with the tablet device to report its position.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.TabletHardwareCapabilities SupportsPressure = int32(1073741824)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the tablet device can detect the amount of pressure the user applies when using the stylus.
